storyInfo: The Doctor and Mon3tr verify the issues plaguing Priestess, and refuse her suggestion. Priestess witnesses the birth of a true 'angel prototype' from the remains of PCS. All across Terra, omens of change begin to appear.

attributes.content: You have determined that the momentous migration has come to a conclusion in reality.

That conclusion has been mapped onto the space you are in. The rift that looks as if it has been plowed open by a Catastrophe bisects the plaza in front of the Basilica. By the rift, there is an even more eye-grabbing pit.
Ugly scars in what should have been a city trapped in stasis.
The ring-shaped machine sits silently within.

attributes.options: Did the PCS system... crash?

attributes.content: You look at Priestess. She remains calm, as if she does not care about what has happened in the slightest.
You feel uneasy.
Analysis complete! Ten standard seconds ago, at least two massive explosions took place in the Basilica plaza.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: I'm certain the instigators were Exusiai, Executor, and a silver-haired Sankta. The constant flickering of the freeze-frames by the explosion point are proof enough.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: The programmatic bombs we helped Exusiai make worked.;The machine's structure shouldn't have been that weak.

attributes.content: We can't pat ourselves on the back just yet, Doctor!
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: (Priestess still hasn't made her next move.)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: (We need a way to stop her from changing the situation, no matter what.)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: You're right. Its structure would definitely have been able to withstand any attacks the angels can execute. It was designed to operate in even harsher environments, after all.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: (Priestess should be able to reactivate it. We need to stop her from doing that.)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: *sigh* Sorry, Doctor.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: I should've come alone to carry out this mission. I never should've let you take on this riskâ€”
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: You're used to standing in front of me by now, Mon3tr.
(Smile);Thanks.

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: Things might not be as bad as you think.
I can verify Priestess's condition now.

attributes.content: Her... condition?
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: You walk past Mon3tr toward Priestess. Mon3tr immediately tenses up, and she pulls on your arm.
Doctor!
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: Don't worry.;Trust me.

attributes.content: After a brief moment of hesitation, she lets go, but decides to stick close to you as you walk ahead.
You stand shoulder-to-shoulder with Priestess.

attributes.options: This city's scars are rather inharmonious.;You've allowed these redundant parameters to mix with your data.

attributes.content: These unremarkable strings ultimately caused the entire program to crash, {@nickname}. There is no guaranteeing a language will operate in eternal perfection.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I know what you want to say. Even Originium, the language we created together, has limitations.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It needs more time to adjust and iterate.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Sometimes I cannot help but wonder if what is truly stopping Originium from reaching perfection is not a design flaw... but us.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Human emotion and reason are both able to fetter the development of a language.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: We debated this several times during the creation process, but there was never a clear winner.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Luckily, we both accepted that this uncertainty exists within Originium.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: ...I don't understand your meaning.

attributes.content: Has memory loss affected your ability for divergent thinking?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I'm glad to see you so perplexed, though. It is a marked difference from how I used to communicate with {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: 'Perfection' implies a strict upper bound. 'Flaw', on the other hand, means we still have the chance for a breakthrough. This was {@nickname}'s stance on the matter.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: When the crisis we must resolve is still inexplicable, chasing perfection will only lead us to our graves.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: No, this has nothing to do with the current circumstances.
You... can't change this situation.;This is different from our first encounter on the deck.

attributes.content: When did you figure it out?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: Just now.
...You could have stopped the programmatic bombs from detonating.;...You could have used Originium to close the rift.;...You could have left the saints trapped in the maze.
It would have been easy for you to do that.;It's like when you awakened and ruined Rhodes Island.
You didn't eliminate Mon3tr and me from the get-go.
You've got problems of your own.

attributes.content: That much is obvious, {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But only now have you mustered up the courage to stand by me.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I had hoped the one standing by my side could have peacefully shared in the solitude that took root deep in our thoughts, during our long hibernations.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It's a shame you can't do that.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: We are not as we were in the past. Far too much has happened since, has it not?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: You really haven't hid anything from me.;You're more like a... riddle.

attributes.content: Still curious about me?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: This 'Mon3tr' no longer has any limitations on her. She can clear up some of your confusion.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: You fear {@nickname} will learn the truth, AMa-10?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: To be honest, I would much rather {@nickname} come to me in person, like earlier.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: My days in the sarcophagus were excruciating. It was as if my thoughts were floating through a fetid morass, wherein I lost all sense of the flow of time.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: My only consolation was the never-ending loop of debates seared into our minds, though not to reassure me of our shared vision.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I have never once doubted my path.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Through 'debate', I got my only chance to communicate with a certain someone againâ€”
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I'm not demanding you understand everything on my mind right away. Before the final day comes, you can continue to walk the path you believe in.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Our disagreements are destined to continue, even if you no longer remember that one's reasons for disagreeing with me.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I look forward to seeing how your beloved Terra can prove to me that your struggle still has some value... the way the people of Laterano just did.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But there is something else I am equally certain of. Oracle will return.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: So, {@nickname}, I will wait for you.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: As she looks out at the city devoid of life, she sighs.
At times, I think they are far too like us. If you had enough time, perhaps...
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: She begins to fade away.
Ah, yes, I can indeed restore AMa-10.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: If you are determined to see it done, make a wish to Originium, {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I will hear your voice.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Priestess vanishes without a traceâ€”your target is gone.
There is only silence, absolute silence. You and Mon3tr are the only ones left trapped inside this colorless ghost town.

attributes.options: She's gone...

attributes.content: Umm... I guess that's it, then?
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: Perhaps.
The Sanktas resolved their crisis by themselves.
I've also confirmed Priestess's current condition.
Her loss of control over Originium is more serious than we thought.

attributes.content: That's really important information, Doctor!
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: While we can't be sure how long she'll need to get back to normal, at the very least, we have a chance to stop her.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Oh, right, she mentioned... Kal'tsit... earlier...
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: I don't trust her, Mon3tr.;We shouldn't wish upon Originium, even if it's for Kal'tsit.

attributes.content: I know. I don't approve of using her methods to bring back Kal'tsit either.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: She inflicted grievous wounds on Rhodes Island and Laterano. Every time she appears, she drops something mind-blowing on us, and then points toward some even more unknowable crisis... I don't understand her at all.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: We've been researching a long time now.
We have our own methods.

attributes.content: We're going to be setting out on a really long road, aren't we?
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: You finally notice what's odd about Mon3tr. Your enemy has retreated, the crisis has passed, but the young woman, normally so lively and energetic, does not smile like she usually does.
She even looks somewhat solemn.

Mon3tr hasn't been reconstructed for very long. You still haven't gotten completely used to her new appearance, nor has she had the time to adapt to the changes in her body, or the loss that cut her to the bone.

But she has been thrown into mission after mission far too quickly. Rebuilding Rhodes Island, saving Laterano... Perhaps it has taken up until now for her to finally have the chance to speak her mind.

attributes.options: No need to be so pessimistic, Mon3trâ€”;Don't give up, Mon3trâ€”

attributes.content: I'll bring back Kal'tsit!
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: I'll also protect Amiya, and you too!
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Mon3tr looks up at you all of a sudden, interrupting your train of thought.
I haven't forgotten what Kal'tsit told me!
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: If the outcome I fear most does come to pass, if the one I least want to see stands in front of us once moreâ€”
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Protect the Doctor. Protect Amiya.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I will engrave this directive into your basic behavioral strategy matrix.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Eternal life is destined to be eternally lonely. I have tasted it.
...You can walk aloneâ€”
Mon3tr.

attributes.options: Listen to me, Mon3tr.

attributes.content: You look at her, and slowly, you begin to speak.

attributes.options: You haven't been in your reconstructed body for very long.
Don't put too much pressure on yourself.;Kal'tsit wouldn't want her hopes to turn into chains.

attributes.content: Err... I think you're misunderstanding something, Doctor.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: I'll always remember how, when I awoke, you just turned around and walked away after giving me a 'welcome back'...
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: Oh...;Sorry, Mon3tr.

attributes.content: It's fine, it's fine. I needed time to get used to not being in a symbiotic relationship after thousands of years, and you needed time to accept the loss of someone you've fought beside for such a long time. And now...
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: We're both standing here, right in front of one another.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: But we've already known each other for quite a while, haven't we, Doctor?
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Under the cannon fire of Londinium, deep inside the secret caverns of the Sarkaz, below the tail of that giant ring flying into the sky in Trimounts, in Milliarium's Sophontheatrum...
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Kal'tsit was there for all of those, which means I was too.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: It's not like I only started to follow her orders to understand you and Rhodes Island when she left us.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Becoming a Rhodes Island Operator, putting up a fight against our creator, protecting Amiya, protecting you. These were my decisions as well...
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: And what I've been doing all along.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Silence.
You look at Mon3tr. Silence links the two of you.

attributes.options: Then count me in, Mon3tr.
We'll bring Kal'tsit back.;We'll walk to the end of this uncharted road.

attributes.content: Eternal life is destined to be eternally lonely, but thankfully, we do not walk alone on the journeys we take. Even if all life is sapped of color, even if all things fade away into nothingness...
We can, must, walk onwards together.
This is what she hoped for.
Oh...
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: What's wrong?;Got another question to ponder?

attributes.content: What's with the look?
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: The counseling session is over, commander! No problems here, I had just come up with a way to get out of this blasted place, and I'll need your help!
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: According to Priestess, this should be a space created by that machine after it connected to Originium, some kind of model based on the future.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: So there's a relation to Originium's properties here.
We can try cracking those abnormal nodes.

attributes.content: Abnormal nodes? Ah, you mean the parts with damage mapped onto them.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: The restriction on the connection between you and the machine should be gone, right?

attributes.content: Yep, I can sense its signal, though its getting weaker by the second.
attributes.name: Mon3tr
Mon3tr
attributes.content: I'll try reestablishing the connection...

attributes.name: Mon3tr
attributes.content: But what then?

attributes.options: Keep requesting refactoring of the abnormal nodes.;Use up the last of its computing power.

attributes.content: Shouldn't be too difficult for me when Priestess isn't meddling with things.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.text: Routing through city communication post backdoor access port...
Temporary access credentials: ELCARO-001... ORACLE. Decoding complete. Authentication passed.

attributes.content: Color seeps out from the ruins of this colorless ghost town.

It starts from the street to the right of the Tower of Revelations, and then through the Notarial Hall and firearms workshops in Pagus Michaelion, to the Sunset Chapel in Pagus Saint Marcel, and then all the way to the chapel square...
Noise returns to the Holy City.
It is the sound of Laterans offering a prayer to life.
The color's back?!
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: Let's go, Mon3tr.

attributes.content: Not going to go say hi to Exusiai?
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: No need to hold her up before her reunion with family and friends.;We need to update the ship on what happened here in Laterano.
Priestess's disappearance will only be temporary.;Priestess will make her next move soon.;Our mission isn't over yet.

attributes.text: Set of directives assigned by personnel with relevant privileges have been completed.

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I've checked your low-level code. Aside from the adjustments I made during maintenance, you've performed a lot of self-upgrades and iterations within a short period of time.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Was this still not enough for your self-repair functions to fix your logic vulnerability?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.text: Vulnerability has been patched. Paradox has been corrected.

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I had great interest in the results of your self-iteration.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) It seems you mistakenly identified yourself as that vulnerability, that paradox.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Was it a side effect of the overclocking? Or did your lack of maintenance, and long-term data transfer with the Sanktas, pollute your database?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) If I had more data, I might be able to find the answer.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) It's a shame the resources I can allocate will not be enough to give you a complete restart.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Otherwise, a command system's self-negation due to its target's wishes would reignite any researcher's interest in the PCS system.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) ... If only we were still in the era when geniuses used reason and opinion to clash over their views.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The ring-shaped machine does not respond. Priestess feels a hint of regret.
(Unknown language) It seems I will have to choose other methods to advance the projectâ€”
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Many mechanical cubes come together to form an annular computational matrix, the core of the machine. They sit there in stony silence.
But all of a sudden, one of the cubes begins to vibrate, a metallic gleam roaming its surface once more.
Soon, a faint, flickering halo begins to form.
From the ruins of the PCS system, a new 'angel' is born.
(Unknown language) ...It restarted?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) It can't be. It didn't respond to me at all, nor does this follow the PCS system's operational logic.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The 'angel' ignores Priestess, quickly ascending into the gaping hole above it, disappearing without a trace soon after.
(Unknown language) A 'prototype' 'angel'?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) But this system was only built to mimic the properties of 'angels'. There was never any 'angel prototype' sample provided when it was constructed.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) A newborn 'angel'?! How could this be...?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: What is that in your hand, Lemuel?
Hehe. A spray can.
I've given the report on the latest data from the barrier hole to Director Saria, but there was something I noticed that got me real curious...
attributes.name: Rhine Staff A

attributes.content: Look. Doesn't that look like some kind of strange flying object to you?
attributes.name: Rhine Staff A

attributes.content: Components Control Section is analyzing it right now. We should be hearing from them soon.
attributes.name: Rhine Staff B

attributes.content: A flying object that can maintain altitude close to the barrier hole would be a major discoveryâ€”
attributes.name: Rhine Staff B

attributes.content: The 'angel' hovers in front of the hole in the barrier. It attempts to reestablish a connection with the individuals scattered amongst the stars, but to no avail.
All it manages to capture are the ripples left behind by energy entities as they die in the depths of space.
And so, it continues to orbit across the land, like a shooting star destined to never fall...
(Unknown language) The scent of life.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: (Unknown language) This land is still young. Is it new life flourishing in the wake of ruination, or has death not come for this place yet?
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Wasn't I... swallowed up by that light...?
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Originium has recorded your information.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) ... 'Originium'?
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Before the light comes, the conclusion is still uncertain. Originium will become our hope.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Where is this place?
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: (Unknown language) 'Terra'.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) We are not alone, my friend.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Did you see the latest news, Miss Koshelna?
attributes.name: Frantic Youth

attributes.content: Lots of mines have shut down, and they've put troops on high alert all across the city.
attributes.name: Frantic Youth

attributes.content: My parents were called in for an inspection... I can't find them.
attributes.name: Frantic Youth

attributes.content: Stay in the classroom for now.
attributes.name: Koshelna

attributes.content: I will help ask around for you. I'm also interested in knowing what is going on.
attributes.name: Koshelna

attributes.content: She calms the child down, and then takes the newspaper from their hand.
Over a few short days, countless rumors have spread across the city, but the most alarming one isâ€”
'Our Originium vein has disappeared. If we can't get any energy out of Mother Earth, how are we supposed to make it through the winter?'
Originium... I shall unravel this mystery.
attributes.name: Koshelna

attributes.content: Only the blood burning within our breasts can see Ursus through the winter chill.
attributes.name: Koshelna

attributes.content: Once we've tidied things up here, it'll do as everyone's new abode, Hierda.
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: Thank you all for your help!
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Good thing you got supplies from our friends at the monastery, otherwise finding a place to stay wouldn't have gone so smoothly.
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: We were worried you had... abandoned us after heading back there...
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: Oh, I'm sorry. The road back was rather rough-going, and I heard lots of news I could barely even believe along the way.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: It's mighty hard to imagine, yeah. The Originium veins, Laterano...
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: The Sanktas at the monastery sure had a lot to say about your return! Wouldn't stop telling us all about it!
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: When that calamity was going on, they wanted to go back to Laterano, but a Catastrophe stopped them.
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: Their halos were shattered, and all they could do was stay here and pray, for themselves, and for their brothers and sisters who had already left...
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: Then you showed up right in front of them, a girl who disappeared without a trace three years ago!
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: You brought them hope, Hierda!
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: Oh my, did I?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I really don't want to let everyone down... Maybe now that we have a fixed shelter, we can help even more people.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: But we still need to take some necessary security precautions.
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: With us pulling out all the stops for our work, we're bound to attract people up to no good. You'll be in danger.
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: Honestly speaking, we might be able to find a better way to do thisâ€”
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: Hierda shakes her head.
I need to see her.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: She must be somewhere here on this land...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Hierda looks out into the distance, despite knowing the vast wilderness will show her nothing in return.
She sees something streaking across the sky.
A shooting star?
Anyway, Originium should not be a source of despair.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I would like to pray for all Infected who sufferâ€”
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Err, will praying... actually do anything?
attributes.name: Infected

attributes.content: Maybe not.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: But when we pray, we will think of each other.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Our bonds bind us together. We are not alone.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: The Iberian coast, a cliff by the sea
A Seaborn clings tight to the sharp rocks.
The sound of distant naval barrages is carried over by the sea breeze, but the Seaborn does not care, focusing its efforts on climbing.
(Excitedly flaps membranous wings)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Unfolds creases enthusiastically)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: The Seaborn finally arrives at the peak of the cliff.
What greets it is a boundless expanse of dry land, and a flash of light up amidst the heavens.
A shooting star?
The Seaborn shifts its body in confusion in response to the momentary distraction, and its appendages brush against something.
A shining black rock rolls off the cliff, dropping straight down into the ocean.
The Seaborn tries to see what it was, but it has already been engulfed by the billowing waves.
